sub_categories: Education and training grants, fellowship, stipend
brief_description: "Free Computer Training" is a social security scheme that provides free of cost computer training to widows, dependents of the ex-servicemen and soldiers.
detailed_description: "Free Computer Training" is a social security scheme by the State Sainik Board, Government of Uttarakhand. Under this scheme, free of cost computer training is provided to widows, dependents of the ex-servicemen, and soldiers.
benefits: The following training is currently being imparted in all the districts of Uttarakhand :
Diploma in Computer Application and Programming (Duration - 1 year). Diploma in Professional Accounting Duration (Duration - 1 year).
eligibility_criteria: The beneficiary should be a widow/ dependent of the ex-servicemen and soldiers. The beneficiary's educational qualification should be 12th pass.

steps: Step 1: Applications for the course are first invited through publicity by the Office of the Director of Sainik Welfare. Step 2: Fill out the form properly and attach all the documents (attested, if required). Step 3: Submit the form to the Office of the Director of Sainik Welfare.

documents_required: Aadhaar Card. Ex-Servicemen Identity Card. Discharge Book. 12th Pass Certificate (For the widow/ dependent).
